sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"游行"之意。
means: parade ： 多指盛大和正式的游行，有检阅等活动。
demonstration ： 侧重指抗议的示威性游行。
procession ： 指举行庆祝活动或盛大仪式时庄严行进的有秩序的游行队伍或行列。

sentence.Network_en: It was a seamless procession of wonderful electronic music.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是一曲优美流畅的电子乐曲。

sentence.Network_en: The parson, heading the procession, had just turned right towards the churchyard.
sentence.Network_cn: 走在行进队伍最前面的教区牧师刚刚向右转弯，朝着教堂墓地走去。

sentence.Network_en: Musicians played at the front and rear of the procession.
sentence.Network_cn: 乐师们在队前和队尾表演。

list.abs: ...ized Production)，是由广义产品(Generalized Product)概念推导出的过程概念，源自ISO9000:2000《质量管理系统————基础和术语》(Quality Management System Standards —— Fundamentals and vocabulary)3.4.1“过程(process)“的定义：“一组将输入转化为输出的相互关联或相互作用的活动.“如上所述————
进程（process）和线程（thread）是操作系统的基本概念，但是它们比较抽象，不容易掌握。 2013.02.16: 计算机是如何启动的？
POLYMER - 瑞的日志 - 网易博客 ... radical polymerization 控制自由基聚合， 加工 processing 反应性加工 reactive processing.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English, via Old French from Latin processio(n-), from procedere 'move forward' (see proceed)

entry.tran: （走路、骑马、开车等的）队伍，行列
entry.def: A procession is a group of people who are walking, riding, or driving in a line as part of a public event.

means.word_mean: 1. (theology) the origination of the Holy Spirit at Pentecost;

sentences.sentence: "the doctrine of the procession of the Holy Spirit from the Father and the Son"

means.word_mean: 2. the group action of a collection of people or animals or vehicles moving ahead in more or less regular formation;
3. the act of moving forward toward a goal

auth_sentence.content: I watched the procession before the flame was lit.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: I watched the procession before the flame was lit.

auth_sentence.content: We all wear unrelieved black like a funeral procession.

auth_sentence.content: He was carried behind his children in the procession.

stems_affixes.word_buile: access[n.接近;入口 v.存取, 接近]+ible能……的→adj.能接近的;可进去的
access接近+ory表形容词或名词→接近的物→附加物,附属的
excess[n.过度,过剩]+ive……的→adj.过分的;过度的
in不+accessible[adj.能接近的;可进去的]→adj.难以接近的
suc随后+cess行走,前进+ive……的→随后跟上→连续的
access接近+ory表形容词或名词→接近的物→附加物,附属的
an=ante前+cest=cess行走,前进+or人→走在前面的人→祖先
an=ante前+cest=cess行走,前进+ry整体→n.祖先;世系,家世
con共同+cess后退+ion动作或状态→n.让步;退位
ne=need需要+cess行走,前进+ary物→n.必需品

stems_affixes.value_cn: 必要性, 需要,必需品
stems_affixes.word_buile: ne=need需要+cess行走,前进+ity性质,特性等→n.必要性, 需要,必需品
process[n.过程;进行 v.加工, 处理]+ion表名词→向前走的队伍
re回+cess行走,前进→走回去→休息
re回+cess行走,前进+ion动作或状态→走回去→撤退
suc随后+cess行走,前进→随后跟上→继续→继续做→成功

stems_affixes.value_cn: 接连发生,继承, 继任
stems_affixes.word_buile: suc随后+cess行走,前进+ion动作或状态→随后跟上→继续发生→继续别人[事业,成功]→继承, 继任

means.word_mean: （人或车辆的）队列，行列；列队行进；游行

sentences.en: A funeral procession filled the street.

means.word_mean: 列队行进;（一个接着一个而来的）一队人,一列人

sentences.en: The students entered the school in procession.

jushi.english: The students entered the school in procession.
A funeral procession filled the street.
